value.string:
"""
 This script is part of ERP5 Web
 
 ERP5 Web is a business template of ERP5 which provides a way
 to create web sites which can display selected
 ERP5 contents through multiple custom web layouts.
 
 This script returns the absolute URL of the current
 document in a pretty way and taking into account
 virtual hosting. The purpose of this script is to be
 able to access documents through a URL such as:
 
 www.mysite.com/mysection/a-document-reference
 
 even if the physical path of the document is
 
 /erp5/web_page_module/33
 
 The default script looks in the acquisition context
 for the first relevant section and build a URL
 based on the section absolute_url and on the
 document reference.
 
 The section parameter can be used to provide
 explicitely a section. This can be useful to
 build URL generators for listbox entries.
 
 More sophisticated behaviours are possible.
 
 SUGGESTIONS:
 
 - change the behaviour of WebSite_getDocumentUrl
 for non anonymous
 
 - change the behaviour of WebSite_getDocumentUrl
 for documents which are not published.
 
 NOTE: absolute_url is the appropriate API to get
 the absolute_url of the current document. It has
 been tweaked enough in ERP5 Web to support virtual
 hosting and permanent URLs.
 
 Base_getPermanentURL is useful to create a permanent
 URL out of a document which has been accessed either
 directly or through a Web Section / Web Site. It is
 the reverse method of WebSite_getDocumentValue.
 """
 # Return absolute URL if our parent is not a Web Section or Web Site
 if section is None and context.aq_parent.getPortalType() not in ('Web Section', 'Web Site'):
 return context.absolute_url()
 
 # Return absolute URL if this is not an appropriate portal_type
 valid_portal_type_list = ['Web Page', ] # WARNING - this is a copy from WebSite_getDocumentValue
 if context.getPortalType() not in valid_portal_type_list:
 return context.absolute_url()
 
 # Return absolute URL if this is not a 'live' document
 validation_state=['draft', 'submitted', 'shared', # WARNING - this is a copy from WebSite_getDocumentValueList
 'released', 'published', 'restricted']
 if context.getValidationState() not in validation_state:
 return context.absolute_url()
 
 # Find the Web Section or Web Site we belong to
 if section is None: section = context.getWebSectionValue()
 
 # Return the URL
 return "%s/%s" % (section.absolute_url(), context.getReference())
